name: U-Substitution (Integration by Substitution)
latex: \int f(g(x))g'(x) dx = \int f(u) du \text{ where } u = g(x)
explanation: U-substitution is the integration counterpart to the chain rule. It simplifies integrals by substituting u for part of the integrand, making the integral easier to evaluate. The key is recognizing when the integrand contains a function and its derivative. After integrating with respect to u, substitute back to x.

steps: Let u = x² + 1, then du = 2x dx
Let u = sin(x), then du = cos(x) dx
